text: Nothris sabulosella is a moth in the family Gelechiidae. It was described by Rebel in 1935. It is found in Asia Minor.Nothris at funet The Global Lepidoptera Names Index has this name as a synonym of Nothris sulcella. The wingspan is 21–32 mm. The forewings are usually uniform dusty grey, sometimes sprinkled with darker grey. There is a blackish grey dot at the middle of the cell. The hindwings are shining bright yellowish-grey.Mitt. Münch. Ent. Ges. 25 : 41 ==References== Category:Chelariini Category:Moths described in 1935
title: Nothris sabulosella
